answers.answer: Something doesn't sound right here. If your EKG was normal they wouldn't have been repeating it every four hours. And then do a Holter? What is your question?
They did the holter first then the ekg.  My question was what would cause me to have pvc mostly while sleeping and nothing on the ekg?

It's really not that unusual to be having more PVCs during sleep. Your dreams alone could cause that to happen. People die in their sleep all the time and that is one reason why. Understand that that is rare and I'm not saying that's what is going to happen to you. People who die usually have underlying serious forms of heart disease. ALL people have PVCs and most have more PACs than PVCs. It's how much heart disease is present which determines if those extra beats are important or not.

question: While I was pregnant and in the hospital they did ecg, every four hours and said it was normal.  They put me on a 24 halter and it showed that I was having pvc's but mostly it was happening in my sleep and got pretty rough.  They told me that when I have these sometime I would kind of stop breathing and that when I jumped really hard in my sleep and it woke me up that was my body's way of making me breathe again.  I was supposed to go see a specialist about it but I couldn't because I was so far along pregnant it was so far away I couldn't go.  I was considered high risk pregnancy ever since I had my first child because I had preeclampsia.  I also hemeriaged while giving birth when I had preeclampsia.This discussion is related to/posts/show/548404.
